snippet: The infants the vaccine was given to had only about a third fewer infections than a control group, but researchers said they wanted to press on, assuming they keep getting financial support.
abstract: Latest clinical trial of world’s leading malaria vaccine candidate produces disappointing results, with infants who received it having only about a third fewer infections than a control group; vaccine, known as RTS, S or Mosquirix, is produced by GlaxoSmithKline.
lead_paragraph: The infants the vaccine was given to had only about a third fewer infections than a control group, but researchers said they wanted to press on, assuming they keep getting financial support.

headline.seo: Malaria Vaccine Candidate Produces Disappointing Results in Clinical Trial
headline.main: Malaria Vaccine Candidate Gives Disappointing Results
headline.print_headline: Malaria Vaccine Candidate Gives Disappointing Results
